clinical_study.official_title: AIDA-RE-1: Adaptive Individualized Hig-Dose Radiotherapy Analysis-Rectum-1. Interventional Study on Neoadjuvant Adaptive-treatment of High Risk Rectal Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to evaluate achievement of complete pathologic response (pCR) in high-risk rectal cancer treated with neoadjuvant concomitant chemotherapy plus adaptive-intensity modulated imaging-guided radiotherapy

detailed_description.textblock: AIDA-RE-1 is an interventional prospective trial for the treatment of locally advanced high-risk rectal cancer. In neoadjuvant setting, patients are treated with standard chemotherapy plus experimental radiotherapy. The total dose to clinical target volume (CTV, rectum and locoregional lymph nodes) is 45 Gy, with a concomitant boost of 5 Gy to gross tumor volume (GTV), delivered with IMRT-SIB (intensity modulated radiotherapy-simultaneous integrated boost) technique in 25 fractions. After 2 weeks of treatment, patients are evaluated with 18 FDG-PET and sequential boost of 5 Gy (in 2 fractions) is planned.

secondary_outcome.description: Acute toxicity is evaluated using CTCAE criteria
QoL is evaluated using EORTC QoL questionnaire
Late toxicity is evaluated using CTCAE criteria
Dosimetric advantage is evaluated using DVHs (Dose Volume Histograms)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of PET-response as predictive factor
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between SUV (Standardized Uptake Value) and pathological response

arm_group.description: 45 Gy plus 5 Gy concomitant boost are delivered to rectum and locoregional lymphnodes (25 fractions); sequential IG-RT (imaging guided-radiotherapy) boost of 5 Gy in 2 fractions is planned with 18-FDG-PET

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- histologically confirmed diagnosis of locally advanced rectal cancer (cT3N+, cT4Nx, local relapse, cT3N0); cT2N+ is acceptable if low rectum is involved
- M0
- ECOG 0-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- M1
- familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP), non-polyposis hereditary colorectal cancer, inflammatory bowel disease
- severe cardiopathy
- previous pelvic RT
